properties.name: email
properties.description: Primary email address of the contact. If you want to associate additional email(s) with this contact, use the other_emails attribute.

options.name: address
options.description: Address of the contact

options.name: company_id
options.description: ID of the primary company to which this contact belongs

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a new contact

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a contact

options.name: Get
options.description: Get a contact

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many contacts

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a contact

properties.name: requester
properties.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Email
options.description: Email address of the requester. If no contact exists with this email address in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Facebook ID
options.description: Facebook ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this facebook_id, then a new contact will be created.

options.name: Phone
options.description: Phone number of the requester. If no contact exists with this phone number in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact. If the phone number is set and the email address is not, then the name attribute is mandatory.

options.name: Requester ID
options.description: User ID of the requester. For existing contacts, the requester_id can be passed instead of the requester's email.

options.name: Twitter ID
options.description: Twitter handle of the requester. If no contact exists with this handle in Freshdesk, it will be added as a new contact.

options.name: Unique External ID
options.description: External ID of the requester. If no contact exists with this external ID in Freshdesk, they will be added as a new contact.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The channel through which the ticket was created

properties.name: options
properties.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: agent
options.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: ccEmails
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) email addresses added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email

options.name: company
options.description: Company ID of the requester. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above). Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: description
options.description: HTML content of the ticket

options.name: dueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved

options.name: emailConfigId
options.description: ID of email config which is used for this ticket. (i.e., support@yourcompany.com/sales@yourcompany.com) If product_id is given and email_config_id is not given, product's primary email_config_id will be set.

options.name: frDueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the first response is due

options.name: group
options.description: ID of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. The default value is the ID of the group that is associated with the given email_config_id. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: name
options.description: Name of the requester

options.name: product
options.description: ID of the product to which the ticket is associated. It will be ignored if the email_config_id attribute is set in the request. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: subject
options.description: Subject of the ticket

options.name: tags
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) tags that have been associated with the ticket

properties.name: updateFields
properties.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: agent
options.description: ID of the agent to whom the ticket has been assigned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: ccEmails
options.description: Separated by a comma (,) email addresses added in the 'cc' field of the incoming ticket email

options.name: company
options.description: Company ID of the requester. This attribute can only be set if the Multiple Companies feature is enabled (Estate plan and above). Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: dueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the ticket is due to be resolved

options.name: emailConfigId
options.description: ID of email config which is used for this ticket. (i.e., support@yourcompany.com/sales@yourcompany.com) If product_id is given and email_config_id is not given, product's primary email_config_id will be set.

options.name: frDueBy
options.description: Timestamp that denotes when the first response is due

options.name: group
options.description: ID of the group to which the ticket has been assigned. The default value is the ID of the group that is associated with the given email_config_id. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

options.name: name
options.description: Name of the requester

options.name: product
options.description: ID of the product to which the ticket is associated. It will be ignored if the email_config_id attribute is set in the request. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return
